list_definition.definition: something used as a sample (of a group or kind of something, especially an object to be studied or to be put in a collection)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: We looked at specimens of different types of rock under the microscope.

list_ex_of_english: Complete specimens are generally 2-3 cm long.
Through the "trading zone" that had been just opened he "reaped a splendid harvest" of more than 300 specimens in less than six hours.
Complete specimens are usually in the range 3-8 cm.
The three specimens described above are assigned to the same species.
Thereafter, the trainee should take the opportunity regularly to review specimens under expert guidance.
I see no ground for assuming that they are different specimens because parties differ in the result about them.
Real specimens too can be available so that the size of an organ, or the appearance of tissue can be appreciated.
Environmental/food samples and stool specimens of food handlers were taken from the observed facilities.
